page.title: 13SOCIAL ACTIVITIES
page.content: The annual carnival is held in August. It began in 1955 with a fancy dress parade and pageant, followed by a dance. Most years a procession of floats is held, with a fete, concert and dance. The Jubilee Club was formed in 1977 to commemorate the Queen's silver jubilee. It is held every Thursday in the Public Hall for the elderly people of the village and they play cards, invite visitors and chat over a cup of tea. They hold a summer outing, a strawberry tea provided by Holsworthy Rotary Club and a Christmas dinner provided by Holsworthy Lions Club. The Women's Institute holds monthly meetings for about 20 members. They learn arts and crafts, hold competitions and invite speakers to address them. They try to support rural life in all ways possible.
